title: It Begins Now

replies.body:
You lost me at "searing sediments".

Lets talk about science before we go on...

Maybe the water is really hot? Maybe it's a dry river bed? :P

'Sands' or 'soil' would have been a better choice for the alliteration route, though soil kinda still evokes moisture to me. 'Sun-baked soil' perhaps? Something using 'barren' or 'arid'? 'Earth' has the drama, but is hard to alliterate.

In fairness, alliteration can be hard in general when you're trying to find a particular feeling.

Sediment is one of those words that can be learned from context rather than strict definition, so I can understand misinterpreting it this way, or that perhaps the environment wasn't described to the extent necessary for such a word to make sense.

The fighting scences is just your character doing this, doing that. While his oppent, J4, just stood there. No counter move, nothing. So is your character fighting a practice dummy? The J4 in your story is motionless. 

Then, without the previous plot to give the audience the connection between the 2 characters, J4 start talking about his struggles to a nobody? J4's dialodge is about his creed, that has nothing to do with loyalty. Yet you jam in this confusing bit at the end.

"Never question my loyalty. You will never know what I had to endure for it."

Also, j4 dialodge is a poor atempt at philosophy.
